intro: Colysis diversa, commonly known as the diverse colysis, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
